DOC.brief_title: Postplacental Intrauterine Device Insertion : A Mixed Methods Assessment Women 's Experience
DOC.detailed_description: Postplacental IUD insertion follow vaginal cesarean delivery effective preventing pregnancy interval insertion , utilized often country China , Mexico Egypt compare US ( Celen , Moroy et al . 2004 ; Eroglu , Akkuzu et al . 2006 ; Kapp Curtis 2009 ; Grimes , Lopez et al . 2010 ) . In addition , current evidence support safety superior cost effectiveness IUD use ( Trussell , Lalla et al . 2009 ; ACOG 2011 ) . Postplacental IUD insertion practice routinely US hospital active family planning faculty ( include University New Mexico Hospital ) , become standard care postpartum contraception option counsel institution . Despite ample evidence support safety effectiveness postplacental IUD insertion , practice uncommon among US provider many woman remain unaware option . Reasons underutilization US may include lack reimbursement , sufficient provider knowledge training , patient awareness . Postplacental IUD insertion also attractive method provision postpartum contraception several reason : woman motivate initiate contraception , pregnant , access medical care readily available . Pain subjectively complex universal experience encompass experiential aspect objective measurement physical pain capture . We know interval IUD placement painful , anxiety fear pain barrier IUD uptake , particularly among adolescent woman ( Allen , Bartz et al . 2009 ) . Pain low satisfaction IUD insertion procedure may limit patient ' endorsement method woman . There insufficient research examine patient 's subjective experience postplacental IUD placement . In addition , limited data physical pain level associate postplacental IUD insertion . Several study examine efficacy intervention reduce pain interval IUD insertion nulliparous multiparous woman ( Hubacher , Reyes et al . 2006 ; Edelman , Schaefer et al . 2011 ; Maguire , Davis et al . 2012 ; Swenson , Turok et al . 2012 ) . DOC.criteria: Englishspeaking Spanishspeaking ( SSO ) woman Women express desire IUD insert immediately follow anticipate vaginal delivery . Unanticipated cesarean delivery Chorioamnionitis Significant postpartum hemorrhage ( estimate blood loss require intervention beyond standard therapy resolve within approximately 10 minute ) Third fourth degree obstetric vaginal laceration Manual extraction placenta Untreated gonorrhea , chlamydia and/or trichomoniasis Known suspect distorted uterine cavity Current use control substance chronic pain management Current substance abuse/ addiction .
